result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric George Kaster

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric George Kaster in court.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Eric George Kaster.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Court also called 22CM1106 and 21CT1444, currently assigned to Branch 01, Judge Davila.  Parties stipulate to transfer of cases to Branch 11.  Court accepts transfer.  Defense informs the court that defendant is trying to get into Veterans Treatment Court.  Court scheduled a status conference.  Case adjourned to Branch 11, Rm 608 CH.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: DNA Notice of Intent to Use

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Swanson, Br. 11.

Defendant Eric George Kaster in court, appear by video with attorney Matthew V Plummer, appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took Judical Notice to 2 prior OWI'S and Case 21CT1444. Sworn for the State: West Allis Officer L. Carlson.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36. Date provided by Br 11 clerk.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-4-22
Signed and and filed: Attorney Matthew Plummer
Proposed Order: Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense

Defendant Eric George Kaster in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference.  Court appoints Attorney Matthew Plummer as counsel at a rate of $100 per hour.  Parties request a preliminary hearing.  Court scheduled matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric George Kaster in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Eric George Kaster appeared by video means. Counsel has not been retained. Attorney Plummer was appointed on other pending matters. Case is adjourned to allow Attorney Plummer to appear. Case is adjourned in Branch 38.  Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

Defendant Eric George Kaster in court.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Status of Counsel. Defense to retain Attorney Scott Wales and request additional time. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Eric George Kaster in court.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set fir Status of Counsel. Defendant request additional time to retain counsel. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Eric George Kaster in court. Jessica Bellows on behalf of Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Indigency Hearing. Defendant informed the Court that he is retaining Attorney Scott Wales. Court ordered case adjourned, Branch 38.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Eric George Kaster in court, appear by video.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:15 am.

22RM023990  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
5/3/2022

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision level 5.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  Scram bracelet ordered to monitor defendant maintains absolute sobriety.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Eric George Kaster in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Eric George Kaster in custody.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Eric George Kaster appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
